# dokploy_docker_container (Data Source)

Fetches detailed configuration for a specific Docker container from Dokploy.



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `container_id` (String) The Docker container ID (short or full).

### Optional

- `server_id` (String) Server ID for remote servers. Leave empty for the local server.

### Read-Only

- `config_hostname` (String) Container hostname.
- `config_image` (String) Container image name.
- `config_json` (String) Full container configuration as raw JSON. Useful for accessing all fields via jsondecode().
- `config_user` (String) Container user.
- `config_working_dir` (String) Container working directory.
- `created` (String) Container creation timestamp.
- `id` (String) Full container ID.
- `image` (String) Container image hash.
- `name` (String) Container name.
- `path` (String) Container path/entrypoint.
- `platform` (String) Container platform.
- `restart_count` (Number) Number of times the container has been restarted.
- `state_dead` (Boolean) Whether the container is dead.
- `state_error` (String) Container error message if any.
- `state_exit_code` (Number) Container exit code.
- `state_finished_at` (String) Container finish timestamp.
- `state_paused` (Boolean) Whether the container is paused.
- `state_pid` (Number) Container process ID.
- `state_restarting` (Boolean) Whether the container is restarting.
- `state_running` (Boolean) Whether the container is running.
- `state_started_at` (String) Container start timestamp.
- `state_status` (String) Container state status (running, exited, etc.).
